FwkSenCnt.MEANING: piece of metal which attracts other metal objects

ExCnt.EX: I once saw a woman whose job it was to make small bar magnets from steel blanks about two inches long .
Magnets are stuck onto the back of stiff paper shapes by a strip of Sellotape . The magnetsare expensive and lose their magnetism if banged or dropped too many times
Cobalt compounds are also used in semi-conductor manufacture and to coat storage battery electrodes . A major use is in making permanent magnets .

FwkSenCnt.MEANING: sb or sth which exerts an attraction

ExCnt.EX: Large cities are powerful magnets attracting a great many people .
He kept on heading west , lured by the magnet of Hawaii .
If however , you're here to be a beach bum , then the beautiful stretch of white sand contrasted against the clear blue sea is a definite magnet for all keen sun-worshippers .
After the opening of the Suez Canal in 1869 , Egypt became an exotic magnet for the Victorian tourist .
I sometimes feel I'm a magnet for trouble .
